did.abstract: The Monday Evening Concerts, first known as Evenings on the Roof, began in 1939 under the direction of Peter Yates. The concerts featured chamber music and experimental works. The collection consists of programs for the Monday Evening Concerts of Los Angeles presented at the Los Angeles Museum of Art (1971/72-1982/83 seasons).

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: The Monday Evening Concerts, first known as Evenings on the Roof, began in 1939 under the direction of Peter Yates; concerts featured his wife Frances Mullen, among others, playing chamber music and other experimental works; Yates retired from the series, but the concerts continued under the direction of Lawrence Morton (1954-71) and Dorrance Stalvey (1971- 2005).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of programs for the Monday Evening Concerts of Los Angeles presented at the Los Angeles Museum of Art (1971/72-1982/83 seasons).

scopecontent.p: Monday Evening Concerts of chamber and experimental works began in 1939 as Evenings on the Roof. In 1954 the present series began. For materials prior to 1971, see Collectoin 965. Moton, Lawrence, 1904- . Materials relating to Monday Evening Concerts, Los Angeles, ca. 1950-1971.
